text: today's recipe is an all-time favorite
it's 11 poppy seed muffin and I think
you guys are going to really really like
it I'm starting with two and a half cups
of flour in my bowl and to that I'm
adding 1 and 3/4 teaspoons of baking
powder 3/4 of a teaspoon of coarse salt
and a quarter teaspoon of baking soda
voila whisk well those are your dry
ingredients and now for the wet
ingredients I have 1 cup of sugar to
that add 2 large eggs everything is
whisked by hand in this recipe it's
really simple and I tried to keep the
recipe as unsweet as possible so that it
wasn't just a cupcake it's actually a
muffin to me that makes a difference I
don't want to be eating cake for
breakfast
whisk your sugar and your eggs add a
quarter cup of milk room temperature and
you'll see why in a minute you want to
make sure that it's room temperature
because you're also going to add one
stick of butter and the butter has been
melted and cooled but if your milk is
cold when you add your butter it will
congeal and then you'll have little bits
of congealed butter in your batter which
is not really fun you also need one and
a half teaspoons of lemon zest as well
as a quarter cup of lemon juice so
always remember to zest your lemons
before you juice them it's much easier
that way depending on the size and the
juiciness of your lemons you may need
one or two lemons for this that's about
right lemons so quirky lemon juice get
your oven preheating to 350 this process
is so quick you're gonna want to make
sure it's preheated add your wet
ingredients to your dry you don't want
to over stir flours flying everywhere
right before it's fully combined I like
to add my poppy seeds and then just
finish stirring this is a pretty poppy
seed
a poppy seed muffin side a scoop makes
it really easy to get even muffins
divide the batter evenly between the
cups of a standard muffin tin I like to
use a baking cup muffin tin should be
about two-thirds full you know these are
not making humongous muffins not like
those ridiculous things that you see at
the store this batter makes just enough
you may need to scrape the ball to make
12 nice size muffins and then I like to
sprinkle the tops with some sanding
sugar which is that sugar that doesn't
melt too much you can completely skip
the sugar you can do poppy seeds on top
you could do regular sugar it's totally
up to you
I do like this sparkly crackly top you
get when you put the standing sugar on
get these into your 350 degree oven and
bake them until the top Springs back
when lightly touched that'll take about
20 minutes let them cool before you eat
them I always say that and then I
usually don't wait but these are
actually cool so we're all right a
perfectly sized muffin I think mmm take
a bite and I think you'll agree these
lemon poppy seed muffins are the best
you
